description.narrative: Facilitation of electronic payments: The expansion of MovilRed''s network financed by IFC will create an important part of the infrastructure required to convert cash into electronic payments and for the acceptance of electronic payments. Making payments electronically rather than in cash has shown to generate greater efficiency that is estimated to reach up to 3% of GDP of developing country economies. Financial Inclusion: MovilRed will make a significant contribution to increase the availability of financial services in Colombia. The company has over five times more points of sale than there are bank branches in Colombia. IFC''s investment will enable the company to leverage this retail network to provide basic financial services ranging from deposits and domestic remittances to simple payment services to the large underbanked population in Colombia. Internet Access for SMEs: MovilRed has entered into an agreement with a major PC manufacturer and an ISP to provide PCs and Internet to small retailers. The Colombian government is supporting this activity with grant funding.

MovilRed (operated by Tranza S.A.S., the Company) is the leading distributor of prepaid cellular phone airtime in Colombia with the largest network of point of sale made up of 80,000 large and small retailers. MovilRed business was created in 1998 as part of CellStar Colombia, a distributor of mobile telecommunication equipment in Colombia, a subsidiary of US company CellStar Corp. CellStar Colombia was acquired by two Colombian entrepreneurs in a management buy-out in 2004, which became Solidda Group S.A.S. in the following year. In 2010, Solidda Group spun off the MovilRed business into a new separate entity called Tranza S.A.S. to obtain a money transfer license. Since then the Company expanded its business lines to domestic money transfer, bill payment, correspondent banking and public transportation recharge services. IFC is considering a potential equity investment of up to US$10 million in the new holding company of Tranza S.A.S. to help the Company becoming one of the key payment service providers and an important partner for banks to offer financial services to the underbanked population in Colombia.

mailing-address.narrative: Hernando Rubio Dacosta Tranza S.A.S. Tel. +57 1 589 5959 mailto:Hernando.rubio@solidda.com

name.narrative: The companys headquarter is in Colombia, Bogota. The investment will be primarily spent for its business expansion in Colombia.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
